section.title: Synopsis
section.codeblock: DROP FOREIGN TABLE [ IF EXISTS ] name [, ...] [ CASCADE | RESTRICT ]

section.title: Description
section.p: DROP FOREIGN TABLE removes an existing foreign table. Only the owner of a foreign table can remove it.

pd.p: Do not throw an error if the foreign table does not exist. Greenplum Database issues a notice in this case.
The name (optionally schema-qualified) of the foreign table to drop.
Automatically drop objects that depend on the foreign table (such as views).
Refuse to drop the foreign table if any objects depend on it. This is the default.

section.title: Compatibility
section.p: DROP FOREIGN TABLE conforms to ISO/IEC 9075-9 (SQL/MED), except that the standard only allows one foreign table to be dropped per command. The IF EXISTS clause is a Greenplum Database extension.
